questiontext.text:
HMS Belfast is a warship situated on the River Thames. Its guns are aimed to fire at a motorway service station 23.0 (D) km away.

Assuming no air resistance, and that the ship and service station are at the same height above sea level, at what velocity must the shells leave the guns in order to reach the service station in a time of 27.0 (T) seconds?

(Give your answer in m/s to 1.d.p.)

(Use a value of g of -9.8 m/s2)

 {1:NUMERICAL:=862.1:0.05#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.}

hint.text: First of all, work out the velocity in the x-direction, and then obtain an expression for the initial velocity in the y-direction. Then combine these two expressions to calculate the angle of trajectory of the shells, and then their velocity.
